alert.note: Alert for Pocahontas; Randolph; Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 11:30AM EDT until June 14 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston West Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Randolph County in northeastern West Virginia... Pocahontas County in northeastern West Virginia... East central Webster County in northeastern West Virginia... * Until noon EDT. * At 1130 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles north of Greenbank to 6 miles northeast of Snowshoe to 7 miles south of Holly River State Park, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Marlinton, Cass Scenic Railroad, Greenbank, Snowshoe, Mingo, Durbin, Dunmore, Monterville, Arbovale, Bartow, Slaty Fork, Minnehaha Springs, Frost, Waneta, Boyer, Edray, Buckeye, Valley Head and Bergoo. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
